Package ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability

Class InputMethodAbility

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.app.AbilityContext
      • ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability
        • ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability.InputMethodAbility
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILifecycle, Context

    public abstract class InputMethodAbility
extends Ability
    Input method ability used to develop an input method application.

    You should extend this class to implement the input method ability. Processes such as enabling and hiding the input method are encapsulated in this class. This allows you to complete the development only by implementing specific APIs, without extra efforts on internal processes.

    InputMethodAbility inherits from the Ability class. The lifecycle (such as startup and connection) of the input method ability is the same as that of a generic ability. In addition, lifecycle callbacks related to the input method service are supported, for example, callbacks for creating the keyboard component container (onCreateKeyboardContainer()) and for displaying the keyboard window (onShowKeyboard()). As an ability, an InputMethodAbility object only can be connected to specific system services supported by the framework.

    Applications developed based on the input method ability is able to adjust the input method window size (via KeyboardController), and perform many operations such as text input and deletion in the client application (via TextInputClient).

    Since:
    3

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateKeyboardInterface

        protected abstract KeyboardDelegate onCreateKeyboardInterface​()
        Called when the input method ability starts. This callback creates a KeyboardDelegate object for the input method keyboard.

        You can implement the delegate interface in which many callbacks are defined for different service processes. For example, KeyboardDelegate#onTextChanged is called when the application enters full-screen mode.

        Returns:
        Returns the keyboard delegate you defined.
        Since:
        3

      • onStart

        protected void onStart​(Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when an ability is started for initialization (it can be called only once in the entire lifecycle of an ability).

        Most initialization operations should be performed by calling this method. For example, you can use the current method to call Ability.setMainRoute(java.lang.String) and Ability.addActionRoute(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) to set the main router and action router for a Page ability.

        Overrides:
        onStart in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates information carried when this ability is started. Note: For a Service ability, null is passed.

      • onConnect

        protected IRemoteObject onConnect​(Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when a Service ability is first connected to an ability.

        This method is called only on Service abilities. You can override the method to return the proxy of a Service ability.

        Overrides:
        onConnect in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates connection information about the Service ability.
        Returns:
        Returns the proxy of the Service ability.

      • onDisconnect

        protected void onDisconnect​(Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when all abilities connected to a Service ability are disconnected.

        This method is called only on Service abilities. You can override the method to clear resources of the proxy of a Service ability.

        Overrides:
        onDisconnect in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates disconnection information about the Service ability.

      • onStop

        protected void onStop​()
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back before an ability is destroyed.

        This method indicates the end of the ability lifecycle. It can be executed after the ability calls the Ability.terminateAbility() method or the last ability slice of the ability calls the AbilitySlice#terminate() method. Generally, this method is used to clear resources.

        Overrides:
        onStop in class Ability

      • onCommand

        protected void onCommand​(Intent intent,
                         boolean restart,
                         int startId)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when Service is started.

        This method can be called only by Service. You can use the Ability.startAbility(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) method to start Service. Then the system calls back the current method to use the transferred intent parameter to execute its own logic.

        Overrides:
        onCommand in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the intent of Service to start.
        restart - Indicates the startup mode. The value true indicates that Service is restarted after being destroyed, and the value false indicates a normal startup.
        startId - Indicates the number of times the Service ability has been started. The startId is incremented by 1 every time the ability is started. For example, if the ability has been started for six times, the value of startId is 6.

        Called when the system configuration is updated.
        Overrides:
        onConfigurationUpdated in class Ability
        Parameters:
        configuration - Indicates the updated configuration information.

      • onCreateKeyboardContainer

        protected ComponentContainer onCreateKeyboardContainer​()
        Called when an input method keyboard window is created.

        You can implement this callback to pass your component container to the framework. The framework assigns the container to the keyboard window for layout.

        Returns:
        Returns the component container you defined.
        Since:
        3

      • onBeginInput

        protected void onBeginInput​(KeyboardController kbController,
                            TextInputClient textInputClient)
        Called to pass a KeyboardController and a TextInputClient object from the framework to the input method when the input starts.

        The framework passes the KeyboardController and TextInputClient objects to the input method. You need to save the two objects for keyboard control and communications between the input method and the client. The default implementation does nothing. If you need to change the input method mode (for example, to the full-screen mode), call KeyboardController#setDisplayMode in this method and set the layout.

        Parameters:
        kbController - Indicates the KeyboardController object for keyboard-related operations, including switching and hiding.
        textInputClient - Indicates the TextInputClient object, which can be used by the input method to insert or delete text.
        Since:
        3

      • onEndInput

        protected void onEndInput​()
        Called when the input stops.

        You can override this method to define operations when the input stops, for example, to release an ongoing process on the client. The default implementation does nothing.

        Since:
        3

      • onShowKeyboard

        protected void onShowKeyboard​()
        Called when the input method keyboard is displayed.

        You can override this method to define operations after the keyboard is displayed. The default implementation does nothing.

        Since:
        3

      • onScreenOrientationChanged

        protected void onScreenOrientationChanged​(int direction)
        Called when the display direction of the screen changes. This callback is invoked in {@link ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability.InputMethodAbility# InputMethodAbility#} which is called when the system configuration changes.

        You can override this callback to define operations upon a display direction change, for example, to enter the full-screen mode. The default implementation does nothing.

        Parameters:
        direction - Indicates the current layout direction. ohos.global.Configuration#DIRECTION_VERTICAL indicates that the screen is displayed vertically. ohos.global.Configuration#DIRECTION_HORIZONTAL indicates that the screen is displayed horizontally.
        Since:
        3

      • onHideKeyboard

        protected void onHideKeyboard​()
        Called when the input method keyboard is hidden.

        You can override this method to define operations after the keyboard is hidden. The default implementation does nothing.

        Since:
        3
